snippet: Sluggishness in the film divisions countered strong performances from cable television channels.
abstract: Viacom and Time Warner report sluggishness at their film divisions, affecting companies' overall performances; Time Warner reports revenue of $6.9 billion in quarter that ended March 31, down 1 percent; net income grew 23.5 percent, to $720 million, or 75 cents a share, compared with $583 million, or 59 cents a share; Viacom reports an 18 percent decline in earnings, to $478 million, or 98 cents a share; overall revenue fell 6 percent to $3.14 billion.
lead_paragraph: Sluggishness in the film divisions countered strong performances from cable television channels.

headline.seo: Viacom and Time Warner Post Lower Revenue
headline.main: Viacom and Time Warner Report Lower Revenue
headline.print_headline: Viacom and Time Warner Report Lower Revenue
